radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral linear atelectases in the lung bases; geographic dropout in signal in the liver consistent with patchy fatty infiltration; high intensity lesion in segment VII of the liver measuring 0.7 cm consistent with hemangioma; no evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation; gallbladder unremarkable; no evidence of stones or abnormal enhancement; prior Nissen funduplication with surgical clips causing blooming artifact; area of slightly low intensity in the midbody of the pancreas likely artifactual; origin of celiac axis is narrowed; left kidney shows a 2.7 cm Bosniak type 2 cyst; no evidence of retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy; right lower lobe atelectasis noted.
